es.deusto.ingenieria.aike.formulation

Class Operator

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.deusto.ingenieria.aike.formulation.Operator

  • public abstract class Operator
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class defining a problem's operator. Operator represents the way problem states are created, since the result of applying an operator on a given problem state is a new problem state.

    Note: The purpose of this class is for specific Operators of a given problem to inherit from it and redefine the methods isAplicable() y effect().

      • apply

        public final State apply(State state)
        Applies the operator on a given problem state to generate a new problem state.
        Parameters:
        state - State on which the operator is applied.
        Returns:
        State resulting from applying the operator or null if the operator can't be applied on the state received as parameter, or an error happens during the operator application.

        • This method's implementation uses methods isApplicable and effect.
        • This method is final to avoid its redefinition by a subclass of Operator; This is justified by the fact that an operator is always applied the same way on a problem state

      • isApplicable

        protected abstract boolean isApplicable(State state)
        Checks whether the Operator can be applied to a state.
        Parameters:
        state - State to which the operator is to be applied.
        Returns:
        • true - if the operator applies.
        • false - if the operator can not be applied.


        Note: This method is protected to avoid its invocation by classes other than operator subclasses or classes outside this package es.deusto.ingenieria.aike.formulation.

      • effect

        protected abstract State effect(State state)
        This method corresponds to the operator's Transition Model. That is to say, its result is the EFFECT of applying the operator on the given state, so a new successor state is generated.
        Parameters:
        state - state is the current problem state.
        Returns:
        State is the newly generated state or null if an error occurs.

        Note: This method is protected to avoid its invocation by classes other than operator subclasses or classes outside this package es.deusto.ingenieria.aike.formulation.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a text string containing the operator's name and cost. Redefinition of method toString() from the class Object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String with the operator's name and cost.
